intro: Hibbertia lasiopus, commonly known as the rough-hairy hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers with red or orange markings. The plant typically grows in heathland and sandy soils, thriving in coastal areas. Its leaves are usually hairy and have a rough texture, contributing to its common name. Hibbertia lasiopus is often found in the eastern and southern regions of Australia, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
